definitions.definition: a hollow place or structure that a bird makes or chooses for laying its eggs in and sheltering its young

examples.text: sparrows building a nest of twigs and dry grass
A rat took the egg while the mother was away from the nest.
The female spends all her time on the nest.
The litters of several different females often occupy the same nest.
The male and female take turns to sit on the nest.
The male uses song to attract a female to his nest site.
You should avoid disturbing the nest until after the eggs are hatched.

definitions.definition: a place where insects or other small creatures live and produce their young

examples.text: The snake will attack if disturbed inside its nest.

definitions.definition: a secret place which is full of bad people and their activities
the home, thought of as the safe place where parents bring up their children

examples.text: to **leave the nest** *(= leave your parents’ home)*

definitions.definition: a group or set of similar things that are made to fit inside each other
to make yourself richer, especially at somebody else's expense, by spending money on yourself that should be spent on somebody/something else
to become able to fly and leave its nest
to leave home and live somewhere else

examples.text: Her children have flown the nest.

definitions.definition: a difficult situation in which a lot of people get very angry

examples.text: His letter to the papers **stirred up a** real **hornets' nest**.

definitions.definition: a discovery that seems interesting but is found to have no value

examples.text: This area of the law is a veritable mare’s nest.

wordOrigin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Latin nidus, from the Indo-European bases of nether (meaning ‘down’) and sit.
